intro: Onychium angustifrons, commonly known as the narrow-leaved onychium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes species known for their distinctive bracts and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
